info.title: Cella DEVELOPMENT API
info.description:
⚠️ ATTENTION: PRERELEASE!  
                  This API is organized into modules based on logical domains (e.g. `auth`, `organizations`, `memberships`).
                  Each module includes a set of endpoints that expose functionality related to a specific resource or cross resource logic.

                  The documentation is generated from source code using `zod` schemas, converted into OpenAPI via `zod-openapi` and served through the `hono` framework.

x-extensions.description: Authorization middleware applied to the endpoint
Rate limiting rules applied to the endpoint

spamLimiter.description: Max 10 requests/hour per IP for email-sending endpoints

emailEnumLimiter.description: Blocks IP for 30 min after 10 consecutive failures

passwordLimiter.description: Blocks email/IP for 30 min after 10 consecutive failures

presignedUrlLimiter.description: Max 2000 requests/hour per user/IP for presigned URLs

totpVerificationLimiter.description: Blocks for 30 min after 5 failed TOTP attempts

tokenLimiter.description: Blocks IP for 30 min after 10 consecutive token failures

x-extensions.description: Caching strategy applied to the endpoint

appCache.description: TTL cache with session-signed token validation

publicCache.description: LRU cache for public page entities

tags.name: me
tags.description:
Endpoints related to the *current user*, meaning the user associated with the active session making
        the request. These routes are distinct from general `users` endpoints: while `users` may operate on
        any user in the system, `me` endpoints are scoped exclusively to the *current user* and follow a
        different authorization flow.

tags.name: users
tags.description:
Endpoints for managing *users* at the system level. Unlike context entities (such as
        `organizations`), a `user` is a "global" entity and not scoped to a specific context. These endpoints
        are intended for administrative operations on any user in the system.

tags.name: memberships
tags.description:
Endpoints for managing *memberships*, which represent one-to-one relationships between a
        `user` and a contextual `entity` (e.g., an `organization`). Each membership includes role information
        and status flags such as `archived` or `muted`. Memberships can also reference parent entities,
        enabling hierarchical context.

tags.name: organizations
tags.description:
Endpoints for managing `organizations`, which are core context entities. Organizations are
        the highest ancestor in the parent hierarchy. They define access boundaries and are often the minimal
        primary scope for permission and resource management.

tags.name: requests
tags.description:
Endpoints for handling incoming *requests* such as contact form submissions, newsletter signups,
        and waitlist entries.

tags.name: entities
tags.description:
Endpoints that operate across multiple *entity types*, such as `users` and `organizations`.
        *Entities* are identifiable domain objects that may be contextual, hierarchical (with parent/child
        relations), or actor-like. These endpoints offer shared logic across modules, including slug validation
        and entity visibility.

tags.name: system
tags.description:
*System level* endpoints for administrative actions and platform wide functionality. These endpoints
        support operations such as user invitations, file uploads, and webhook handling.

tags.name: auth
tags.description:
*Authentication* endpoints supporting multiple sign-in methods, including email/password, OAuth
        (Google, Microsoft, GitHub), and passkeys (WebAuthn). These routes cover user sign-up, sign-in, password
        recovery, email verification, account linking, and impersonation for system admins.

tags.name: attachments
tags.description:
Endpoints for managing file based *attachments* (e.g. images, PDFs, documents) linked to
        entities such as organizations or users. Files are uploaded directly by the client; the API handles
        metadata registration, linking, access, and preview utilities.

tags.name: pages
tags.description:
Endpoints for managing *pages*, which are product entities supporting realtime sync and offline
        capabilities. Pages can be organized hierarchically and are used in /docs.

tags.name: metrics
tags.description:
Endpoints for retrieving system level statistics and basic observability data. Includes internal
        metrics as well as simple, high level counts for entities such as `users` and `organizations`.

tags.name: activities
tags.description:
Endpoints for retrieving *activities* (audit log entries). Activities track create, update, and
        delete operations across all resources. This serves as an audit trail and can be extended for webhook
        delivery.

cookieAuth.name: cella-development-session-v1
cookieAuth.description: Authentication cookie. Copy cookie from your network tab and paste it here. If you don't have it, you need to sign in or sign up first.

NotFoundError.description: Not found: resource does not exist.

UserBase.description: Base user schema with essential fields for identification and display.

BadRequestError.description: Error returned when the request is malformed or contains invalid data.

UnauthorizedError.description: Error returned when authentication is missing or invalid.

ForbiddenError.description: Error returned when the user lacks permission for the requested action.

NotFoundError.description: Error returned when the requested resource cannot be found.

TooManyRequestsError.description: Error returned when rate limits are exceeded.

ActivityError.description: Error info for failed CDC activities (dead letters)

baseVersion.description: Entity version when read (for conflict detection)

example.message: Suggero accusator demens terreo amiculum comitatus necessitatibus candidus.

get.description: Returns a paginated list of *activities* (audit log entries). Activities track create, update, and delete operations across all resources.
Returns auth health status including whether the client IP is rate-limited for email enumeration protection.

post.description: Checks if a user with the specified email address exists in the system.

get.description: Validates and invokes a token (for password reset, email verification, invitations, mfa) and redirects user to backend with a one-purpose, single-use token session in a cookie.
Get basic token data from single-use token session, It returns basic data if the session is still valid.
Allows a system admin to impersonate a specific user by ID, returning a temporary impersonation session.
Ends impersonation by clearing the current impersonation session and restoring the admin context.

post.description: Resends an invitation email with token to a new user using the provided email address and token ID.
Signs out the *current user* and clears the active session.
Generates a new TOTP key for current user and returns a provisioning URI and Base32 manual key.
Confirms TOTP setup by verifying a code from the authenticator app for the first time. On success, TOTP is registered for current user.

delete.description: Delete TOTP credential for current user.

post.description: Validates the TOTP code and completes TOTP based authentication.
Registers a new user using an email and password. Sends a verification email upon successful sign up.
Registers a user using an email and password in response to a system or organization invitation.
Sends an email with a link to reset the user's password.
Sets a new password using a single-use session token in cookie and grants a session immediately upon success.
Authenticates an existing user using their email and password.
Register a passkey for passwordless authentication by verifying a signed challenge and linking it to the *current user*. Multiple passkeys can be created for different devices/browsers.

delete.description: Delete a passkey by id from the *current user*.

post.description: Initiates the passkey registration or authentication flow by generating a device bound challenge.
Validates the signed challenge and completes passkey based authentication.

get.description: Starts OAuth authentication with GitHub. Can be used for account connection, email verification, invitation process, defaults to authentication.
Starts OAuth authentication with Google. Can be used for account connection, email verification, invitation process, defaults to authentication.
Starts OAuth authentication with Microsoft. Can be used for account connection, email verification, invitation process, defaults to authentication.
Handles GitHub OAuth callback, retrieves user identity, and establishes a session or links account.
Handles Google OAuth callback, retrieves user identity, and establishes a session or links account.
Handles Microsoft OAuth callback, retrieves user identity, and establishes a session or links account.
Returns the *current user*.

delete.description: Deletes the *current user*. This also removes the user's memberships (cascade) and sets references to the user to `null` where applicable.

put.description: Enable or disable multifactor authentication for the *current user*. Always requires passkey or TOTP reauthentication.

get.description: Returns authentication related data of *current user*, including sessions, OAuth accounts, and sign in options.
Returns a list of pending memberships with entity data.

delete.description: Ends one or more sessions for the *current user* based on provided session IDs.
Removes the *current user* from an entity they are a member of.

get.description: Generates and returns an upload token for uploading files or images to a private S3 bucket, scoped to the *current user* and organization

200.description: Upload token with a scope for a user or organization

get.description: Unsubscribes the user from email notifications using a personal unsubscribe token. No authentication is required, as the token implicitly identifies the *current user*.
Returns a list of *users*.

delete.description: Deletes one or more *users* from the system based on a list of IDs. This also removes the user's memberships (cascade) and sets references to the user to `null` where applicable.

get.description: Retrieves a *user* by ID.

post.description: Creates one or more new *organizations*.

post.description:
Checks whether a given slug is available across all entity types (e.g. *organizations*, *users*).
      Primarily used to prevent slug collisions before creating or updating an entity.

get.description: Stream real-time changes for public entities (entities with no parent context). No authentication required. Use offset for catch-up, live=sse for SSE streaming.

schema.description: Starting offset: 'now' for live-only, or activity ID to receive missed notifications

parameters.description: Starting offset: 'now' for live-only, or activity ID to receive missed notifications
parameters.name: offset

schema.description: Set to "sse" for live updates (SSE stream)

parameters.description: Set to "sse" for live updates (SSE stream)
parameters.name: live

200.description: Catch-up activities or SSE stream started

cursor.description: Last activity ID (use as offset for next request)

get.description: SSE stream for membership and entity notifications affecting the *current user*. Sends lightweight notifications - client fetches entity data via API.

schema.description: Starting offset: 'now' for live-only, or activity ID to receive missed notifications

parameters.description: Starting offset: 'now' for live-only, or activity ID to receive missed notifications
parameters.name: offset

schema.description: Connection mode: 'sse' for streaming, 'catchup' for one-time fetch

parameters.description: Connection mode: 'sse' for streaming, 'catchup' for one-time fetch
parameters.name: live

cursor.description: Last activity ID (use as offset for next request)

post.description: Invites one or more users to the system via email. Can be used to onboard system level users or admins.

get.description: Generates and returns a presigned URL for uploading files to an S3 bucket.

post.description: Receives and handles Paddle subscription events such as purchases, renewals, and cancellations.
Sends a newsletter to members of one or more specified organizations.
Submits a new *request* to the system. Supported types include contact form, newsletter signup, and waitlist entry.

get.description: Returns a list of submitted *requests* across all types: contact form, newsletter, and waitlist.

delete.description: Deletes one or more *requests* from the system by their IDs.

get.description:
EXPERIMENTAL. Returns raw system observability data (e.g. node level statistics or runtime insights).
      Primarily intended for internal monitoring and diagnostics.

Returns Node.js process health metrics and OpenTelemetry runtime instrumentation data.
      Includes memory usage, CPU time, uptime, and event loop utilization.

user.description: CPU time spent in user mode (microseconds)

system.description: CPU time spent in system mode (microseconds)

get.description:
Returns basic count metrics for entity types such as `users` and `organizations`.
      This endpoint is public and uses a 1 minute in memory cache for performance.

Returns entity cache statistics including hit rates, sizes, and invalidations.
      Useful for monitoring cache performance and tuning.

coalescedRequests.description: Number of coalesced requests (avoided duplicate fetches)

uptimeSeconds.description: Seconds since metrics were last reset

get.description:
Returns metrics for the sync flow: CDC Worker → ActivityBus → SSE streams.
      Includes event counts, connection stats, and tracing span data.

eventsReceived.description: Total CDC events received from worker

eventsEmitted.description: Total events emitted to SSE streams

activeConnections.description: Current number of active SSE connections

pgNotifyFallbacks.description: Times pg_notify was used as fallback

recentSpanCount.description: Number of recent spans in memory

errorCount.description: Number of spans with error status

get.description: Returns a paginated list of *attachments* for the organization.

post.description: Registers one or more new *attachments* after client side upload. Includes metadata like name, type, and linked entity.

rejectedItemIds.description: Identifiers of items that could not be processed

rejectionReasons.description: Map of rejected item ID to reason code

rejectedItemIds.description: Identifiers of items that could not be processed

rejectionReasons.description: Map of rejected item ID to reason code

delete.description: Deletes one or more *attachment* records by ID. This does not delete the underlying file in storage.

get.description: Returns a single *attachment* by ID. Supports CDC cache via X-Cache-Token header.

schema.description: Entity ID or slug. ID is always preferred.

parameters.description: Entity ID or slug. ID is always preferred.
parameters.name: orgIdOrSlug

put.description: Updates metadata of an *attachment*, such as its name or associated entity.

get.description: Redirects to the file's public or presigned URL, depending on storage visibility.

post.description: Creates one or more *memberships*, inviting users (existing or new) to a context entity such as an organization.

delete.description: Deletes one or more *memberships* by ID. This removes the membership but does not delete the associated user(s).

put.description: Updates the *membership* metadata, such as role, `muted`, or `archived` status.

post.description: Accepting activates the associated membership. Rejecting simply removes the invitation token.

get.description: Retrieves members (users) of a context entity by ID, including their associated *membership* data.
Returns pending memberships for a context entity, identified by ID. This does not include pending invitations for non-existing users.
